summary.para: Represents information about an operating system, such as the version and platform identifier. This class cannot be inherited.

content.para: The T:System.OperatingSystem class contains information about an operating system. For example, the P:System.Environment.OSVersion property returns information about the currently executing operating system in an T:System.OperatingSystem object.

By design, the T:System.OperatingSystem class is not a general purpose means of describing an operating system, and you cannot derive a more inclusive type from the T:System.OperatingSystem class. If you need a type to contain other information about an operating system, create your own type, then include a field of type T:System.OperatingSystem and any additional fields, properties, or methods you require.
The following code example creates objects of the T:System.OperatingSystem class with selected values for the P:System.OperatingSystem.Platform and P:System.OperatingSystem.Version properties.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.OperatingSystem class, using the specified platform identifier value and version object.

content.para: One of the T:System.PlatformID values that indicates the operating system platform.
A T:System.Version object that indicates the version of the operating system.
version is null.
platform is not a T:System.PlatformID enumeration value.
The following code example creates objects of the T:System.OperatingSystem class with selected values for the P:System.OperatingSystem.Platform and P:System.OperatingSystem.Version properties.

summary.para: Creates an T:System.OperatingSystem object that is identical to this instance.

returnValue.para: An T:System.OperatingSystem object that is a copy of this instance.

content.para: The following code example illustrates the use of the M:System.OperatingSystem.Clone method to make a copy of an T:System.OperatingSystem object. The clone is compared with the original object to show that they are not the same object.

summary.para: Populates a T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo object with the data necessary to deserialize this instance.

content.para: The object to populate with serialization information.
The place to store and retrieve serialized data. Reserved for future use.
info is null.

The context parameter is reserved for future use; it is currently not implemented in the M:System.OperatingSystem.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method.
For more information, see the M:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo.AddValue(System.String,System.Object,System.Type) method.

summary.para: Converts the value of this T:System.OperatingSystem object to its equivalent string representation.

returnValue.para: The string representation of the values returned by the P:System.OperatingSystem.Platform, P:System.OperatingSystem.Version, and P:System.OperatingSystem.ServicePack properties.

content.para: The following code example illustrates the use of the M:System.OperatingSystem.ToString method to display T:System.OperatingSystem objects.

summary.para: Gets a T:System.PlatformID enumeration value that identifies the operating system platform.

content.para: The following code example creates several T:System.OperatingSystem objects and displays the P:System.OperatingSystem.Platform property for each.

summary.para: Gets the service pack version represented by this T:System.OperatingSystem object.

returnValue.para: The service pack version, if service packs are supported and at least one is installed; otherwise, an empty string ("").

content.para: A service pack is used to distribute software updates for the operating system on which it is installed. However, not every operating system uses service packs.
The service pack version, if available, is already correctly formatted for display.
The following code example demonstrates the P:System.OperatingSystem.ServicePack property.

summary.para: Gets a T:System.Version object that identifies the operating system.

returnValue.para: A T:System.Version object that describes the major version, minor version, build, and revision numbers for the operating system.

content.para: The following code example creates several T:System.OperatingSystem objects and displays the P:System.OperatingSystem.Version property for each.

summary.para: Gets the concatenated string representation of the platform identifier, version, and service pack that are currently installed on the operating system.

returnValue.para: The string representation of the values returned by the P:System.OperatingSystem.Platform, P:System.OperatingSystem.Version, and P:System.OperatingSystem.ServicePack properties.

content.para: By default, the value returned by P:System.OperatingSystem.VersionString is the same as the value returned by the M:System.OperatingSystem.ToString method. However, an implementation of the .NET Framework for a different platform might return a more appropriate string for that platform.
The following code example demonstrates the P:System.OperatingSystem.VersionString property.
